data.enText: without care/attention

data.chText: 不经意的；无忧无虑的；漫不经心的；不在乎的
data.enText: not showing much care or thought; seeming not to be worried; not wanting to show that sth is important to you
a casual manner

data.chText: 我只是随便说说，并不当真。
data.enText: It was just a casual remark─I wasn't really serious.

data.chText: 他讲话时试图显得不在乎，但我知道他心里着急。
data.enText: He tried to sound casual, but I knew he was worried.

data.chText: 他们对安全问题采取无所谓的态度。
data.enText: They have a casual attitude towards safety (= they don't care enough) .
without paying attention to detail
a casual glance

data.chText: 即便再马虎的人也能一眼看明白是怎么回事。
data.enText: It's obvious even to the casual observer.
not formal
not formal
casual clothes (= comfortable clothes that you choose to wear in your free time)

data.chText: 家庭聚会和其他非正式场合
data.enText: family parties and other casual occasions
work
not permanent; not done, or doing sth regularly
casual workers/labour

data.chText: 学生有时做些旅游方面的零工。
data.enText: Students sometimes do casual work in the tourist trade.
They are employed on a casual basis (= they do not have a permanent job with the company) .
relationship
without deep affection
a casual acquaintance
a casual friendship
to have casual sex (= to have sex without having a steady relationship with that partner)
by chance
happening by chance; doing sth by chance
a casual encounter/meeting
a casual passer-by

data.chText: 热心的爱好者和碰巧来参观的人都认为这个展览有意思。
data.enText: The exhibition is interesting to both the enthusiast and the casual visitor.

data.chText: 此病不会通过偶然接触传染。
data.enText: The disease is not spread by casual contact.

data.chText: “他说了我什么？”她尽量装着不在意地问。
data.enText: ‘What did he say about me?’ she asked as casually as she could.
They chatted casually on the phone.

data.chText: 随便穿着牛仔裤和T恤衫
data.enText: dressed casually in jeans and T-shirt

data.chText: 他确信那似乎漫不经心的姿态是有意装出来的。
data.enText: He was sure that the casualness of the gesture was deliberate.
clothes
informal clothes or shoes
dressed in casuals
worker
a casual worker (= one who does not work permanently for a company)

simple_means.memory_skill: cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 →〔没有准备〕降临的 → 偶然的

ex.chText: 我的母亲在乡村过着无忧无虑的生活。
ex.enText: My mother lives a carefree life in the country.

ex.chText: 他是个了无牵挂的老人。
ex.enText: He is a carefree old man.

ex.chText: 罗伯特记起了在海滩上度过的无忧无虑的夏日时光。
ex.enText: Robert remembered the carefree summers at the beach.

synonyms.bx: 指没有任何担忧或烦恼之事的。

ex.chText: 他对待什么事情都随随便便。
ex.enText: He takes a casual attitude towards everything.

ex.chText: 他们在家度过了一个轻松的假期。
ex.enText: They spent a casual holiday at home.

ex.chText: 露西漫不经心地瞥了一眼报纸。
ex.enText: Lucy took a casual glance at the newspaper.

synonyms.bx: 指轻松随意、无忧无虑，不把任何事放在心上的。

ex.chText: 在店内随机选择了一些女性进行了调查。
ex.enText: The survey was conducted based on a random selection of women who were in the shop.

synonyms.bx: 指无计划或目的地选择或发生的。

ex.chText: 事实上，他们的相遇并不是偶然的。
ex.enText: In fact, their meeting was not accidental.

ex.chText: 由于设计方案意外泄漏，该公司失去了优势。
ex.enText: The company lost its advantages due to an accidental leak of its designs.

synonyms.bx: 指计划外或无意间发生的。

ex.chText: 她在一次偶然的谈话中第一次听到他的名字。
ex.enText: She first heard of his name in a casual conversation.

ex.chText: 教授对他的论文随口点评了几句。
ex.enText: The professor made some casual remarks about his paper.

synonyms.bx: 指随意、并无计划的，只作定语。

tr: hasty and without attention to detail
example: a casual (or cursory) inspection failed to reveal the house's structural flaws
an ability to interest casual students
showed a casual disregard for cold weather
drove his car with nonchalant abandon
was polite in a teasing nonchalant manner
a difficult feat performed with casual mastery

tr: appropriate for ordinary or routine occasions

example: using their Christian names in a casual way

tr: characterized by a feeling of irresponsibility
example: a broken back is nothing to be casual abou

tr: occurring or appearing or singled out by chance
without or seeming to be without plan or method
example: information collected by casual methods and in their spare time
a casual correspondence with a former teacher

value.def: If you are casual, you are, or you pretend to be, relaxed and not very concerned about what is happening or what you are doing.

example.ex: It's difficult for me to be casual about anything...
He's an easy-going, friendly young man with a casual sort of attitude towards money.
example.tran: 他是个随和、友善的年轻人，不太在意金钱。

value.tran: 漫不经心的;(故作)随意的

example.ex: 'No need to hurry,' Ben said casually.
Bayldon asked the question with studied casualness.
example.tran: 贝尔顿故作轻松地问了那个问题。

value.def: A casual event or situation happens by chance or without planning.

example.ex: What you mean as a casual remark could be misinterpreted...
example.tran: 你随便说的一句话，可能就被曲解了。

example.ex: Even a casual observer could hardly have failed to notice the heightening of an already tense atmosphere.
example.tran: 即便是不经意的旁观者也一定已经觉察到本就紧张的气氛进一步加剧了。

value.tran: (事件或情况)偶发的，偶然的，碰巧的

value.def: Casual clothes are ones that you normally wear at home or on holiday, and not on formal occasions.

example.ex: I also bought some casual clothes for the weekend.
example.tran: 我还买了些周末穿的休闲装。

example.ex: They were smartly but casually dressed.
example.tran: 他们穿得很漂亮，但又都很随意。

value.def: Casual work is done for short periods and not on a permanent or regular basis.

example.ex: ...establishments which employ people on a casual basis, such as pubs and restaurants...
example.tran: 酒吧、饭店等雇用临时工的地方

example.ex: It became increasingly expensive to hire casual workers.
example.tran: 雇用临时工越来越贵了。

trans: 随便的；漫不经心的；非正式；不经意的；无忧无虑的；不在乎的；马虎的；疏忽的
休闲星期五；便装星期五；休闲周五；星期五便装日；周五便装日
休闲服饰；休闲装；休闲服装
临时积水区；因下雪临时出现的水区

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to fall, to drop, to fall down 落下；降临
rootsaffixes.title: cad, cas, cid, cay

partsOfSpeech.dec: cad 落下；降临 + ence 表行为 → 落下的〔声音〕→ 声音的抑扬
casc〔= cas〕落下；降临 + ade 表动作的结果 →〔水〕落下 → 小瀑布
cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 →〔没有准备〕降临的 → 偶然的
cas 落下；降临 + ual 有…性质的 + ty 表情况 →〔突然〕降临 → 事故
co 共同 + in 使… + cid 落下；降临 + e → 使一同降临 → 巧合
de 向下 + cad 落下；降临 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 向下堕落的 → 颓废的
de 向下 + cay 落下；降临 → 向下掉 → 衰退
de 加强 + cid 落下；降临 + uous …的 →〔树叶、表皮〕落下 → 落叶的；脱落的
in 使… + cid 落下；降临 + ent 表名词 → 使〔突然〕降临 → 偶然事件
oc 加强 + cas 落下；降临 + ion 表动作 → 使…降临 → 发生
oc 加强 + cid 落下；降临 + ent 表名词 →〔太阳〕落下的地方 → 西方

rootsaffixes.indicate: 表形容词，“有…性质的，属于…的”，由连接字母-u+-al构成
rootsaffixes.title: -ual

partsOfSpeech.dec: act 动作，行动 + ual 有…性质的，属于…的 → 行动的 → 实际的
cas 降临 + ual 有…性质的，属于…的 → 莫名其妙降临的 → 偶然的
grad 走 + ual 有…性质的，属于…的 → 渐进地行走 → 逐渐的
mut 变换 + ual 有…性质的，属于…的 → 变换的 → 互相的
